summary:
States must prevent entry and freeze assets of designated individuals and entities. Exemptions may be granted for humanitarian needs or if it furthers the Council's objectives.
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
 
3(e) Imposes a freeze on funds, assets and economic resources of persons/entities designated by the Committee, 
exceptions for:
  i. Basic expenses (food, rent, medicine, taxes etc.) with Committee notification and no objection within 2 working days;
  ii. Extraordinary expenses with Committee approval; 
  iii. Judicial, administrative or arbitral liens/judgments entered prior to this resolution.

4. These measures enter into force 30 days from adoption unless Sudan complies with commitments/demands.

5. Ready to consider modification/termination of measures on Committee recommendation or after 12 months.

6. Demands Sudan cease offensive military flights in Darfur, invites African Union Ceasefire Commission to share information.

7. Reaffirms and expands measures imposed by resolution 1556 (2004) to all parties/belligerents in North, South and West Darfur.

8. Threatens further measures under Article 41 if parties fail to fulfil commitments.

9. Remains seized of the matter.
